website_summaries.verdict: An official ball of many tournaments, King of the Beach has enough weight to resist the wind that often comes with outdoor play.
pros: Not much sand sticks to it
Heavy enough to resist wind during outdoor play
cons: Occasionally loses air mysteriously, so be sure to bring your pump to the beach

website_summaries.verdict: Ball's design is made for beach play, both recreational and competitive games.
pros: Official volleyball for King of the Beach tournaments
Primarily designed for outdoor play with an all-weather composite cover
Cover is hand-stitched for maximum quality
Uses an 18-panel construction to ensure it will last a long time when playing on sand or grass courts
cons: Some balls tend to leak air

customer_reviews.title: There's a difference between this KOB and a real KOB volleyball
customer_reviews.text: I have a real Spalding KOB volleyball and when compared to this one, there's definitely a difference. The real Spalding KOB is softer and the ridges are more defined, came deflated in an original box. This one came in a plain cardboard box and comes pre-inflated. I don't mind the pre-inflated (although it was over inflated). The quality is not too bad, but not worth the $50 the authentic ball is worth.
customer_reviews.author: joe@cheninfo.com

customer_reviews.title: Best ball for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I run a large Meetup grass volleyball group and have gone through dozens of volleyballs over the past 10 years. While the Wilson AVP is a good ball, the Spalding KOB is our primary choice. The KOB is pretty durable and I prefer how it handles the wind. The only negatives is quality control. One ball out of every 15 or so will fail to hold air. I was able to return those for replacement, so not a huge hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McClintock

customer_reviews.title: It's hard and hurts your fingers
customer_reviews.text: We used to play with the Wilson AVP Game Volleyball but we lost it one day. At that time the price for the Wilson ball was $20 more than usual. I saw this ball also have a very good review and the price was good. So I bought it instead of the Wilson ball. This ball was sold by Amazon, not from a 3rd party, and I paid $44.99 before tax. Here are the bad things: 1. The bladder sticks out. 2. The surface is kind of rough and hard. It hurts your fingers. 3. The ball is kind of light.
customer_reviews.author: Qijin L.

customer_reviews.title: Both are great but the Spalding has a slightly better texture
customer_reviews.text: Flagship beach volleyball. The only reason you are reading reviews on this ball is to decide between this and the Wilson AVP series. Both are great but the Spalding has a slightly better texture, and I have to agree that it seems to do better in the wind. It does lose air faster than the Wilson so get a pump, though...a small sacrifice for a better user experience (which is more important in my book)
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: This is a different ball!
customer_reviews.text: I am concerned that the ball I received is not a true King of the Beach ball. I have been playing with the KOB ball for years now and this one feels different (much harder, no cushion). NOTE: After a couple months of use, I bought the same type of ball from a different company. The other supplier's ball is significantly different. The panels on the ball are different. The one from Amazon is made in Vietnam and the one from the other supplier is made in China. The other supplier seems like the ball I've been used to for the past ten years.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Best Sand Volleyball made
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of sand volleyballs out there, but this one is the most popular everywhere I've played (mostly Florida and New Jersey). It looks, feels like the old leather ball but doesn't develop the "shaped like an egg" syndrome the leathers got. Probably a couple of grams heavier than the AVP or AVP II ball but that's a good thing, especially in the wind. Unlike (IMHO) the AVP ball it's a volleyball players ball and NOT something branded mostly to generate revenue. This is probably the best synthetic ball ever made...if you're serious about your sand volleyball then get one!
customer_reviews.author: dregenthal

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: KOTB ball is being taken over by Mikasa, not sure if these Spalding ones are different now... they feel different and NOT good. Not worth $35 even $20... go with the Molten USA VB beach balls for ~$45, currently they are the best deal for quality beach ball.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Lop-Sided & No Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Hello I recently purchased a Spalding King of the Beach ball on Amazon. To my surprise, the ball came full inflated and when I brought it to practice my coach said it was lop-sided, possibly an effect of shipping. I already put my name and phone number on it since my last ball was stolen. I usually purchase AVP balls but I thought I would try the Spalding this time. I tried to submit a complaint on their website in hopes of getting a replacement but their page does not work, when I press the submit button nothing happens. In general, very disappoint with this supposedly ‘high-quality’ ball.
customer_reviews.author: VF

customer_reviews.title: RIP
customer_reviews.text: This ball is great until it gets wet, then it turns into a rock. Looks like it was discontinued and Mikasa now makes a new version. Moment of silence for the KOB that is no longer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron G

customer_reviews.title: A Great Beach Volleyball!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift, but it was well received and a replacement for a well used ball that doesn’t hold air anymore. It felt good to the hands and they are looking forward to using it at the beach this summer. It was a requested ball by someone who has played on volleyball leagues in the summer, so that says something about its quality and feel in use!
customer_reviews.author: Fir Tree

customer_reviews.title: Losing air within 3 nights of playing
customer_reviews.text: Really frustrated with this ball. I played outdoor with it 3 times. The first time it was great and everyone liked how soft it was. The 2nd day about halfway through our games someone said, "I think the ball is going flat", and by the third day of playing the ball couldn't hold air for a single set of games (about 2.5 hours). Don't waste your money on this ball. As far as I can tell I got an official ball and not one of the knock-offs.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Did not last like all other balls
customer_reviews.text: The version I received was last's years version... Didn't have a problem with that. However, I play a lot of volleyball and have not used this ball much (it's 1 of 3 i have)... And for no reason, it deflated this weekend and will no longer hold air. I listened for a hole/puncture... Nothing. It was fine when used on Saturday at a tournament ball for the first time, and grabbed it yesterday for the first time and saw the malfunction. Believe it was defective but have no avenue to repair / replace. Not worth 40$ for use for maybe one hour a week use for 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Susan Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball for all levels
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent ball, and for its price, it's the best you'll get. I've always played with the Wilson AVP volleyballs as they're still my go to ball, and my other 6 volleyballs are the of the wilson brand. This one however, from past experience, doesn't float around as much in the wind. So I got it for that purpose. It's a bit softer so it's more forgiving on the forearms of those getting back into volleyball or are new to it. As far as sand sticking less to it than the wilson ball, they're the same. Overall it's a great ball for the price point and you cant go wrong with it, be a beginner or more advanced player.
customer_reviews.author: Cori Cheloha

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, overpriced popped ball after few times using!
customer_reviews.text: Literally popped at where you fill the air in with the nipple being blown out. Only used about 3-4 times.. Extremely disappointed in this product. Apparently It is cheaply made and I seem to not be the only one that hates this ball, or should I say the ones who make it..
customer_reviews.author: Ben Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: A nice feeling ball that went flat in the initial hour of use. We understand that occasionally problems happen so reached out to Spalding customer service and have had no response on over a week. They claim that due to Covid that we should expect a 2 week response rate. What planet do they live on. Stunningly terrible business acumen. What a shame - used to be a great brand.......... And it get worse..... i just got off the phone with Spalding customer service (after 40 minute wait) and was told they have outsourced the production of the product and therefore wont support it.
customer_reviews.author: hajo

customer_reviews.title: Is this why they were so cheap???
customer_reviews.text: Myself, along with everyone I play volleyball with, use Spaldings offical King of the Beach volleyball's. I am deeply disappointed, both balls do not hold air any longer. We've used these balls only three times. I am sadly disappointed. I will still use the official KOB volleyballs, I am not sure if I will continue purchasing them from this source or not.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ross

customer_reviews.title: This ball feels great in my hands!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is used at pretty much every tourney I've played in. So far great quality. I love playing with Spalding's balls. They are nice and soft, and don't leave marks where ever they hit your body. I've taken Spalding's balls to the face a couple of times and it's not that bad. When I've taken other balls to the face (Molten) they've just about knocked me out.
customer_reviews.author: Corbino

customer_reviews.title: Great ball....I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: I play sand volleyball several times a week, so, I purchased this after reading reviews and using the ones offered at my local volleyball league. The ball itself is great. I think I was the unfortunate recipient of a "bad ball" as mine doesn't hold air and goes flat before the end of a game. I have contacted the company to see what they can do. Overall I would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality sand volleyball.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best beach ball by far
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this ball for a little over a year. It can be used for all skill levels, as it is easier to pass and hit than the Wilson AVP. You can also get more controlled shots with it, for those with the skill to perform these. The durability is good, mine is going on its second beach season in good condition. It is easy to clean with water and a towel if it gets muddy. Also if it gets wet it dries quickly. By far the best beach ball hands down, way better than the marshmallow like AVP.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking air after three days of playing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball in January when it was on sale. We started playing this spring with the ball. After playing with it a couple times it already leaks air and is unusable. The KOB ball is a great ball but don’t buy here. You could get sent a defective ball. Find a store that sells it and go there. That way you can make sure you don’t get junk. Very dissatisfied with how this turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Terrawolf101

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels like a knock off KOTB ball...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived to me just in the shipping box. No original packaging or anything. It felt nothing like the KOTB ball I had owned in years previous and honestly feels like a knock off. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hetrick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Holding Air
customer_reviews.text: I got this ball a couple of months ago to use at our weekly sand volleyball league. It was great for a while but recently developed some sort of leak. There are no obvious punctures or spots that seem like they should leak, but the ball will not hold air at all. We just used it about once a week for a month and a half. The use we got out of it in that short time was not worth the price that we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar776

customer_reviews.title: This ball goes away in 2019!
customer_reviews.text: The standard here in the mid-atlantic region. Noticed that recently these are coming in a little"harder". They break in quickly, but the first couple hours are interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Memmo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality volleyball. Surprised they came inflated
customer_reviews.text: This is the primary ball used in the PNW .. Seattle.. and I’m very picky! But these are great. Got exactly what I expected. Great end of season find.. before they rebrand from Spalding
customer_reviews.author: K. Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: It's the 'king of the beach' for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: These are used by pros for a reason. They have a great touch to them, so they don't slip when you're setting, and they're nice and soft so they feel good when passing. I've seen a few indoor balls with small lumps or rips, but I've never seen one of these balls with any problems. They're also pretty easy to wash off with a paper towel and some cleaning solution, so they'll keep looking new. For beach, this is the ball of choice for many players, and it's for good reason.
customer_reviews.author: IAmTheDanimal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ball
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite ball. The leather on it is not the same as the original King of the Beach but it still feels amazing. The pop on it is great, bumping is comfortable, easy to set and everything else you could ask for. This is such a good investment for any starting or regular beach players.
customer_reviews.author: Teriyaki boi

customer_reviews.title: Losing air fast after two months
customer_reviews.text: Great ball for a month or two. Then it leaks. I only used in sterile courts. Not a puncture.
customer_reviews.author: AaronHe

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the very first day i used this ball there was already a lump in it. I play outdoor a lot so it was very annoying to have to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: George Moreno

customer_reviews.title: King of Beach - most popular outdoor volleyball in our group
customer_reviews.text: A couple hundred people play intermediate VB in our area and this is the most popular outdoor volleyball on the courts. It's still new and looks like it will take a while to break in, but it's being used... that's what i was hoping for. The Never Flat, 2013 vb is crap, don't by that ball! I went to a large sports store and all they had was the Never Flat (Spalding) ball, so i purchased KOB online. If there is a large group of people playing vb you might see the Never Flat sitting on the sidelines... people don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, and consistent response
customer_reviews.text: This has been our preferred ball for years, after the old Wilson leather ball became unavailable.
customer_reviews.author: C  Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: Still My Favorite Ball After 30+ Years
customer_reviews.text: Plays awesome. Lasts long. Responds well to passing, cut shots, jump serves and everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Galt

customer_reviews.title: Our reference outdoor volleyball in Portland, OR area
customer_reviews.text: I used to hate this volleyball. It has fairly thick seams that you would expect would interfere with passing or setting, but after several summer seasons in sand and grass, I've grown to like it. Now I won't play with any other ball outdoors. I've noticed some variability in the construction. Sometimes the seams are thicker in some production runs of the ball, but the quality has been very consistent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: This ball is sweet! It reminds me of the original full leather ...
customer_reviews.text: I've played beach volleyball competitively for over 20 years. This ball is sweet! It reminds me of the original full leather 18 panel ball that the AVP used in the good ole days of side-out volleyball. (oh how I miss that game) If you want a solid ball for beach play, I don't think you will find a better one. I only wish the seller would offer discounts on higher volume purchases, as I need several for training my new protégé. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: wade

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down the best sand volleyball on the market
customer_reviews.text: I play competitive volleyball 3 times a week and tournaments on Saturdays.. This is hands down the best sand volleyball on the market. Does take a little breaking in. I've used all other volleyballs and this is the winner
customer_reviews.author: kolby johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great ball, troublesome quality control
customer_reviews.text: Bought one after using numerous, great play, soft, wears well. Bladder went out on first after3 months and spalding replaced, bladder went out on replacement and they replaced again, bladder started to fail on third and gave up assuming they were even willing to replace again. I'll go back to the Wilson ball I had previously...
customer_reviews.author: Woodwardia

customer_reviews.title: great micro textured surface
customer_reviews.text: This ball sets the absolute standard in beach volleyballs. Durable, great micro textured surface, and flies perfectly. Make sure you inflate properly.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: This is the new style KOTB Ball
customer_reviews.text: I will confirm for those confused, this ball has been updated from the picture display. It looks much better in my opinion and feels great as always. The best outdoor ball , especially for grass. However, it also does really bad with water. Quick to get water logged. 35$ is a great price. Worth the purchase for high and low level play.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great feel in affordable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid ball playing outdoor. It has a nice feel and heavy enough not affected by the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Kobe Brian

customer_reviews.title: A good beach volleyball
customer_reviews.text: I like these beach volleyballs better than all the others. They are fun to play with and hold up extremely well. Not everyone prefers these but they are particularly good in windy conditions. I have found them to be fairly consistent ball to ball. I have played with, literally, hundreds of them.
customer_reviews.author: W from Chicago Metro

customer_reviews.title: The volleyball I received kept deflating after minutes of gameplay ...
customer_reviews.text: The volleyball I received kept deflating after minutes of gameplay. I submerged it in water and air was seeping out the corners of the seems... yes, multiple corners and yes, I do know hoe to take care of my balls. I don't know if it was a factory defect or the shipping/handling... but ugh... it blows having a clean volleyball in my room for decoration -_-
customer_reviews.author: Moises

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Deflated after a few games. Only used on lawn and stored inside.
customer_reviews.author: lovingmom

customer_reviews.title: bounces well
customer_reviews.text: bounces well - haven't won a game yet but thats not the vendors fault - i just suck
customer_reviews.author: Cardiff Ca.

customer_reviews.title: I know these balls are/were "The" ball, but mine went flat in a matter of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I deflated the ball for travel, and it wouldn't hold air after that.
customer_reviews.author: LukeHinsy

customer_reviews.title: Both balls that I bought is not able to hold air
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these balls and unfortunately both volleyballs is not able to hold the air for even 4-5 rallies. We realized it just outside our return timetable. Upon contacting Spalding, they said that they don't manufacture it any more and hence is not able to give a warranty on this. DONT BUT THIS BALL !!!!
customer_reviews.author: inasisi

customer_reviews.title: I got a fake.
customer_reviews.text: Came without any Spalding packaging. Looks identical but does play like the real thing, has a funny sound and action. I thought it just needed to be broken in but after two months of play it is still funky and off. I got burned by Amazon. If you order one and it shows up without packaging, return it asap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this ball for my boyfriend for his birthday. It is great! :) Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Austen A.

customer_reviews.title: Best grass or beach volleyball
customer_reviews.text: Great volleyball for grass or beach. I love the feel of the panels when setting.
customer_reviews.author: Noe

customer_reviews.title: Good playing ball
customer_reviews.text: Anyone looking at this ball knows that there are 3 main balls of this caliber and price range. I've tried all 3 and like all 3, and cannot recommend any one more than the other. So far, this King seems to be holding up to the elements moderately well.
customer_reviews.author: DVD watcher

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: People are using it in random places, and they seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lim

customer_reviews.title: Best beach ball
customer_reviews.text: With this ball, Spalding has found the perfect weight and feel. It's not too heavy that you have to pound it to get it over the net, and it's not so light that the wind pushes it around like a marshmallow. It's composite cover does a good job of resisting wear and water-logging. The feel on serving, passing, setting, and hitting is perfect. It's firm, but not hard. Even the wimpiest forearms can pass this ball all day with no complaints. Not cheap, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: defective ball
customer_reviews.text: this product, at least the one i recieved lost airpressure the first week we purchased it. normally the Spalding outdoor volleyball is one of my favorite balls, softness and feel are its best atributes . i hope to have better luck next time purchasing this ball.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ball
customer_reviews.text: First one came warped and they immediately replaced. Love it. It's the best beach volleyball out there. My son plays open tournaments and only uses this ball
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two balls like this before and didn’t get any issue
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two balls like this before and didn’t get any issue.... but this time I Guess I didn’t get lucky on the ball i got. I used it 2 times (in a regular way - playing beach volleyball). And the ball is flat. I put air several time in it and it kept getting flat. So I can’t use it anymore....
customer_reviews.author: sébastien

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Always nice to get a 50$ ball in stores on sale. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: HeloShopper

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Best ball that I have ever Purchased. I recommend it to every one who is looking for a great ball. Sure it might be more expensive than some unbranded knock-off but you get what you pay for, GREAT product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best beach vball
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball, IMO this is the best ball for beach volleyball and Amazon was the only place I could find the original King of the beach
customer_reviews.author: Daria Z

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it was supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I ordered for playing on courts with the "older" players who like and use this ball. Well made, heavier so it's good in wind.
customer_reviews.author: John Kaster

customer_reviews.title: Great balls, I wish they cost less though.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. They preform as expected. 5 stars over all.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher McGee

customer_reviews.title: Love the KOB
customer_reviews.text: But it's personal preference whether you like this vs the Mikasa or Wilson. We like it because you can feel the panel geometry so it seems more forgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Mrozewski

customer_reviews.title: Ball is misshappen after ~5 uses
customer_reviews.text: The ball is staying inflated, but it is misshapen and does not fly or pass as expected. I still use it for peppering but it is not used for actual play. Buy a ball at a sporting goods store instead of online, I won't be making the same mistake twice!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Henry

customer_reviews.title: the volleybal used by all but a few competitive players in the Denver metro area.
customer_reviews.text: Some people find this composite volleyball a little 'rubbery' in feel, but it isn't the volleyball used by the overwhelming number of players in the metro Denver area by accident. It lasts a long time, keeps its' shape, resists dirt, stiffness, is easy on the skin, and has a nice feel for bumping, setting, and hitting. Some people insist on a real leather volleyball, but when used outdoors leather gets stiff and must be replaced in a year or two. We use to have to replace our real leather volleyballs every year or two, but we have been using this composite volleyball for years and they hold up great!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hermes

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Feels better than the Wilson Official AVP ball
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Feels better than the Wilson Official AVP ball. If you play beach/sand volleyball it's worth it to get either official balls over the replicas; they hurt a lot less on the bump and are quite a bit more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Pho

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun during Covid-19
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get a little exercise in during a pandemic
customer_reviews.author: CAV

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beach ball
customer_reviews.text: All of my friends think its great too. They always ask, "can we use your ball?"
customer_reviews.author: Micky Gann

customer_reviews.title: The best ball
customer_reviews.text: They use this in my out door volleyball league. The weather is horrible here and the ball is resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: This ball was a defect. Probably a reject.
customer_reviews.text: These balls are the best for grass doubles. This one was a defect. Leather too stiff and the ball is slightly smaller and heavier than all the other ones in the ball bag. But I didn’t realize that in time so can’t return it. Their defective product is now my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cowles

customer_reviews.title: Newer spalding not holding air
customer_reviews.text: Balls are not holding air. Out of these 8, 5 don't hold air for 1 game. I have older Spalding balls in another bag of 9 where 2 slowly leak. Don't have a problem with the Wilson balls just like the feel of spalding more.
customer_reviews.author: E J

customer_reviews.title: A very good ball
customer_reviews.text: This is from a seasoned player and for many years my friends and i would only play with the best volleyball ever made;the Top Flight true leather ball. This ball is very close in quality to that ball and has a great feel about it. The ball is not slick like most non leather balls. The ball was slightly different than the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Lostracco

customer_reviews.title: Mysteriously Deflated.... Won't Hold Air after 2 weekends of Play
customer_reviews.text: Mysteriously deflated after two weekends. Was used on a sandy beach, no punctures or rough play. It looks pristine, just won't hold air any more.... Waste of $50 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great for competition
customer_reviews.text: I like this ball better than the wilson avp ball...it seems softer and the panels give you more control passing
customer_reviews.author: Christi Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Good ball, but inconsistent quality.
customer_reviews.text: One ball held up just fine. It came inflated has not lost pressure for a few weeks. The second I ordered came slightly deflated and would not hold pressure for more than a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: bplaag

customer_reviews.title: slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The ball came in a little warped and not very well-pumped. I also have to keep pumping it back up again because it keeps losing air, and I only just bought it. A good ball overall, but durability isn’t that great.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Lane

customer_reviews.title: Best beach volleyball on market
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these outdoor balls and typically buy one each season. The texture of the ball is great for setting. It feels solid yet it won't bust your wrists. I recommend this ball.
customer_reviews.author: E. Razz

customer_reviews.title: Great ball, maybe not the most durable
customer_reviews.text: I may have just gotten a bad one, but after only three months of light use it has begun to leak. I hadn't overinflated it or anything of that sort. It was a great ball when it consistently held air though
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Core failure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ball for my daughter to enjoy this summer. Unfortunately the core failed after the first use. The ball is now lopsided and un-usable for proper play. I have personally had this same type of ball for 5 years and it has held up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have played with it several times and it works. Was kind of expensive though
customer_reviews.author: Hanu

customer_reviews.title: Best volleyball out there
customer_reviews.text: Best volleyball out there. Bought a new one for Christmas because we wore the last one out after having it for 3 or 4 years. And we play a couple of times a week. Great price for a well-made ball. Don't get caught playing with any cheaply made volleyball.
customer_reviews.author: S. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Hard to play.
customer_reviews.text: The ball is heavier than I expected. Its seams are visible and feels like hard texture. I didn’t like it. The Mikasa beach and Wilson beach, both officials, are much better.
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA CUNHA SANTOS

customer_reviews.title: Best Feel and Touch of Any Beach V-Ball
customer_reviews.text: This is the best beach volleyball I have ever played with for touch and feel. They feel like soft leather and are grippy to the touch which gives more control for hand setting and also shots involving wrist snap to create spin like the "Cutty." I've played with every type of outdoor ball and there is no comparison to this one. Make sure you are buying the real thing that says USA Beach Official Tour on it and not one of the cheaper "replicas" that feel slippery and plastic-y.
customer_reviews.author: Will Rahill

customer_reviews.title: Different than pictured
customer_reviews.text: I received a different ball than the one in the review. It doesn't have the American flag logo on it, and the text is in gold, not yellow. Not sure if this is just a newer edition of the official ball or a replica.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Definitely king of the beach
customer_reviews.text: Apparently no longer the official beach ball but overall I would say it is the best to play with. It has a very soft cover and holds up well on the beach. Because it has a suede-ish covering it does require a little more cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: 4America

customer_reviews.title: Favorite ball. You will need to pump it up ...
customer_reviews.text: Favorite ball. You will need to pump it up a day or two before using due to bladder expansion. Also check the pressure after a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ball...
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Spalding's "King of the Beach". I also have the Mikasa "Beach Champ", but find it kind of egg-shaped and unpredictable. The "King" has the edge for bumping, serving, and spiking, while the "Beach Champ" gets the edge for setting and material feel. So I prefer the Spalding, but if you can get a good deal on the other one it's also a good ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jakes

customer_reviews.title: Happy I Bought!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. I had read the earlier comments complaining about the ball coming deflated, but I risked purchasing the ball anyways. The vendor must read the comments, because my ball was fully inflated when I received it (Kudos to the vendor)! I'm thrilled, and the ball is working out great at our beach volleyball practices!
customer_reviews.author: Alexia

customer_reviews.title: Great ball.
customer_reviews.text: My family loves beach volleyball, so we spent a little more for this ball along with our own net. Ball plays very well, consistent bounce, good balance and weight. I only did not give a 5 because we have not had it long enough for a full durability endorsement, and it lost air a little faster than expected (but refilled normally).
customer_reviews.author: Saucy

customer_reviews.title: Loses Air
customer_reviews.text: I have used KOB Balls in the past; how ever the most recent two orders seem to have been less that par. I have only payed with the KOB Balls in teh order for about a month; and now both are losing pressure and will not hold. One of the two that I ordered now has a split in the seam and will only hold minimal Air.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Great quality ball, holds air well and after some sessions of use becomes very soft. I can tell that the valve's construction **might** become an issue as it is very slightly tilted, but otherwise I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Needs some breaking in as there is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Needs some breaking in as there is some protective layer on surface but after a few outdoor games touch and feel is good
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy Ball
customer_reviews.text: The ball I received was lumpy and came in no packaging, just a plastic bag. The ball I received is smaller than the official AVP tour ball. I thought they were both supposed to be the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Rundomatic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of control and usability for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ball for control. Discrete panels work just like the old Top Flite 18, without the extra heavy weight of the leather ball. It also does not get chewed up or waterlogged like the TF-18 when it rains, since it is synthetic. The texture of the synthetic cover on this ball may actually allow for a better grip than on the Top Flite under most circumstances. I have found that most people (that have a preference) would rather play with this ball than the Wilson AVP or Mikasa balls. After playing with the King of the Beach, the others feel like cheap indoor/outdoor balls.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: The ball has a good feel to it for beach play
customer_reviews.text: The ball has a good feel to it for beach play. However, the unit I received was a little warped. It realized it after I put my name on it and chose not to return the ball.
customer_reviews.author: V. Reddy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great ball, works perfect on the gulf beach sand! Very durable, we use it for more than 10 games each day
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Best ball for beach
customer_reviews.text: If you are competitive in any way, this is the right ball. The ridges make a great feel for setting and the leather is soft. This isn't meant to get wet, though.
customer_reviews.author: M S Rumble

customer_reviews.title: Another Leak in seam!
customer_reviews.text: I had one these volleyballs (the same brand) before and it lasted for almost 8 years with no problem. I loved it! This volleyball had a leak in it that was obvious within a day. This seems to be a similar issue with other buyers who posted. Dissatisfied with this product and returned it for a full refund so I could buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Graves

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Check for manufacturing quality.... Mine has paint all over it
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I play a lot of beach volleyball and always had muscle tears in my shoulder from the previous generation of KOB when they got moist and sandy (added weight). This one is lighter. I haven't had any problems with my shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Detail Obsessed Skunk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Spalding KOB ball
customer_reviews.text: Had to get one before they’re all gone! Spalding stopped manufacturing these is what I heard
customer_reviews.author: Addison Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Great to play outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Is a good product. Just what i ordered and wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Lesya Lysen

customer_reviews.title: Great ball to play Beach Volley
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ball, it has a great touch and it is not too big. I am playing on the beach where it can be very windy and the ball stay pretty steady.
customer_reviews.author: PruneAndLeo

customer_reviews.title: Solid ball, should last a while
customer_reviews.text: Solid outdoor ball, used around here both in grass and sand volleyball. Maybe don't pump it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Mompri85

product_meta.title: Spalding King of the Beach/USA Beach Official Tour Volleyball
product_meta.description: Material Type:King of the BeachDesigned and built specifically for competitive play outdoors, the official Spalding King of the Beach and USA Beach Tour volleyball features a soft-touch, all-weather composite cover that offers the durability for all weather conditions. The ball's machine stitched, 18 panel construction offers true flight and control with a good feel.
feature_bullets: Official volleyball of King of the Beach and USA tournaments

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars663 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
